snippet.title: The Supreme Court Blocks The Politicization Of International Law
snippet.description: The U.S. is not the world's courtroom. read »

snippet.title: The Supreme Court Unanimously Rejects Universal Jurisdiction
snippet.description: A wise example of judicial restraint. read »

snippet.title: How President Obama Could Be Swept Away With His Executive Orders That Defy Congress And The Courts
snippet.description: Apparently President Obama has become convinced that he can make magic with that pen he keeps talking about, the one he plans to use for signing executive orders to revive his beleaguered presidency. Executive orders are irresistible, because a president doesn’t have to propose anything, debate the issues, endure hearings [...] read »

snippet.title: Supreme Court Rebuffs Human Rights Claimants From Abroad
snippet.description: American courts have long been a favored destination for plaintiffs. Compared to many other judicial systems, U.S. courts are - with rare exceptions - free of corruption and have well-established precedents and procedures that make them fair and predictable forums to bring cases. Though they are not swift, cases in [...] read »

snippet.title: Why the Supreme Court Will Strike Down All of Obamacare
snippet.description: The Court kept asking the government for a principle that would limit its interpretation of the Commerce Clause, and its failure to come up with one is fatal to the government’s case. read »

snippet.title: Supreme Court Eyes Scope Of Controversial Alien Tort Statute
snippet.description: Within days after hearing oral arguments on whether corporations can be sued for human rights violations under the Alien Tort Statute (ATS) last month, the Supreme Court instructed the lawyers in the case to file a new round of briefs analyzing whether federal courts could serve as a forum in [...] read »

snippet.title: Obama's Plan To Seize Control Of Our Economy And Our Lives
snippet.description: President Obama has made clear that he’s determined to continue pushing his “progressive” agenda, regardless of constitutional limitations on his power. He aims to have his way by issuing more and more executive orders. read »

snippet.title: Effective U.S. Attorney General Defined
snippet.description: The chief law officer and adviser to the president must successfully balance law and politics. read »
